children.title: Docs
children.description: Everything you need to know to get started.
children.content: Docs The API section covers the available options and methods to customize the slider and the Examples are ready-to-use boilerplates to help you customize your animation.

children.title: Custom ease animation
children.description: Example using a custom ease function.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example Custom ease function .slider { width: 100%; padding-bottom: 25%; } .slider img { width: 100%; } .wrapper { width: 100%; margin: 0; } @media only screen and (min-width: 1024px) { .wrapper { width: 1024px; margin: auto; } } This example uses a Robert Penner classic ease function, for more ready-to-use functions check Easie. function bounceOut(time, begin, change, duration) { if ((time /= duration) < 1 / 2.75) { return change * (7.5625 * time * time) + begin; } else if (time < 2 / 2.75) { return change * (7.5625 * (time -= 1.5 / 2.75) * time + 0.75) + begin; } else if (time < 2.5 / 2.75) { return change * (7.5625 * (time -= 2.25 / 2.75) * time + 0.9375) + begin; } else { return change * (7.5625 * (time -= 2.625 / 2.75) * time + 0.984375) + begin; } } simpleslider.getSlider({ container: document.getElementById('myslider'), delay: 3, duration: 1, ease: bounceOut });

children.title: Default Sliding Transition
children.description: Example using pixel values for a default sliding transition.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example Simple horizontal slider example #myslider { width:612px; height:612px; } var imgSlider = simpleslider.getSlider({ container: document.getElementById('myslider'), prop: 'left', init: -612, show: 0, end: 612, unit: 'px' });

children.title: Default slider with no options
children.description: Example using data attribute to define a slider container and no initalization options.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example No options on initialization example div[data-simple-slider] { width:612px; height:612px; } simpleslider.getSlider();

children.title: Fading/Opacity transition
children.description: Example using css opacity for a fading slides transition.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example Fade in/out transition example #myslider { width:612px; height:612px; } var imgSlider = simpleslider.getSlider({ container: document.getElementById('myslider'), prop: 'opacity', unit: '', init: 0, show: 1, end: 0 });

children.title: Full page transition
children.description: Example showing a slider taking the full window size.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example Slider occupying full page html body { margin: 0; padding: 0; } #myslider { width:100%; } #myslider img { width:100%; height:auto; } var container = document.getElementById('myslider'); var height = isNaN(window.innerHeight) ? window.clientHeight : window.innerHeight; var imgSlider = simpleslider.getSlider({ container: container, autoPlay: true, prop: 'left', unit: '%', init: -100, show: 0, end: 100 }); container.style.height = height + 'px';

children.title: Lightbox Integration
children.description: Example of integration with a third-party library such as a lightbox when clicking a slide.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example Lightbox integration example #myslider { width:612px; height:612px; } This example is using Prinzhorn/0 script for providing the lightbox functionality. var imgSlider = simpleslider.getSlider({ container: document.getElementById('myslider'), prop: 'left', init: -612, show: 0, end: 612, unit: 'px' });

children.title: Mask Sliding transition
children.description: Example of a slider that masks images behind it instead of moving them.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example Mask sliding example #myslider, #myslider div{ width:612px; height:612px; } var imgSlider = simpleslider.getSlider({ container: document.getElementById('myslider'), prop: 'width', init: 0, show: 612, end: 612, unit: 'px' });

children.title: Pause slide
children.description: Example of using the pause method to control a slider.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example Pause slide change example #myslider { width:612px; height:612px; } Pause Resume var imgSlider = simpleslider.getSlider({ container: document.getElementById('myslider'), prop: 'left', init: -612, show: 0, end: 612, unit: 'px' }); document.getElementById('pause').onclick = function () { imgSlider.pause(); }; document.getElementById('resume').onclick = function () { imgSlider.resume(); };

children.title: RequireJS usage
children.description: Example of usage within a RequireJS environment.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example RequireJS example #myslider { width:612px; height:612px; } require(["../dist/simpleslider"], function(simpleSlider) { simpleSlider.getSlider({ container: document.getElementById('myslider') }); });

children.title: Responsive Layout Example
children.description: Example using css media queries to achieve a responsive layout with a maxium width value.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example Responsive layout example .slider { width: 100%; padding-bottom: 25%; } .slider img { width: 100%; } .wrapper { width: 100%; margin: 0; } @media only screen and (min-width: 1024px) { .wrapper { width: 1024px; margin: auto; } } simpleslider.getSlider({ container: document.getElementById('myslider'), init: -100, show: 0, end: 100, unit: '%' });

children.title: Reverse sliding direction
children.description: Example showing how to reverse the carousel direction using the programmatic API.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example Reverse sliding direction example .nav-example { position: relative; width: 612px; height: 612px; } .nav-slider { position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; z-index: 1;} #myslider { width:612px; height:612px; } a.slide-button { position: absolute; padding: 300px 0px 0px 15px; top: 0px; left: 0px; z-index: 12; width: 30px; height: 612px; color: #FFF; background-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.4); text-decoration: none; font-weight: 600; box-sizing: border-box; } #next-button { left: auto; right: 0px; } < > var isNext = true; var imgSlider = simpleslider.getSlider({ container: document.getElementById('myslider'), prop: 'left', init: -612, show: 0, end: 612, unit: 'px' }); document.getElementById('prev-button').onclick = function(e) { if (isNext) { imgSlider.reverse(); isNext = false; } imgSlider.next(); e.preventDefault(); }; document.getElementById('next-button').onclick = function(e) { if (!isNext) { imgSlider.reverse(); isNext = true; } imgSlider.next(); e.preventDefault(); };

children.title: Right to left sliding transition
children.description: Example of a transition that slides from right to left instead of the default animation.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example An example with images sliding from right to left #myslider { width:612px; height:612px; } var imgSlider = simpleslider.getSlider({ container: document.getElementById('myslider'), prop: 'left', init: 612, show: 0, end: -612, unit: 'px', delay: 2, duration: 1 });

children.title: Slides containing no image
children.description: Example showing slides that contains text-only.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example Text content example #myslider { width:612px; height:612px; } #myslider div { width:552px; height:612px; background:#D8EDEC; padding:30px; } Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. children.title: Top to bottom transition
children.description: Example of a transition animation that moves slides from top to bottom instead of the default animation.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example Vertical sliding example #myslider { width:612px; height:612px; } simpleslider.getSlider({ container: document.getElementById('myslider'), prop: 'top', init: -612, show: 0, end: 612, unit: 'px' });

children.title: Touch swipe example
children.description: Example showing how to use a touch/swipe interface to control the slider.
children.content: {$page.description} View this example Touch swipe example .slider { width: 100%; padding-bottom: 25%; } .slider img { width: 100%; } .wrapper { width: 1024px; margin: auto; } @media only screen and (max-width: 1024px) { .wrapper { width: 100%; margin: 0; } } This example is using the Hammer.js lib to provide the swipe gesture support. var isNext = true; var sliderElem = document.getElementById('myslider'); var slider = simpleslider.getSlider({ container: sliderElem }); var manager = new Hammer.Manager(sliderElem); var Swipe = new Hammer.Swipe(); manager.add(Swipe); manager.on('swipeleft', function() { if (isNext) { slider.reverse(); isNext = false; } slider.next(); }); manager.on('swiperight', function() { if (!isNext) { slider.reverse(); isNext = true; } slider.next(); });

children.title: Examples
children.description: Lot's of ready-to-use examples showing different usages.
children.content: {$page.description} Available Examples Responsive layout example Default slider with no options Default slider with options Fading/Opacity transition Full page transition Lightbox integrated Mask sliding transition Pause slide RequireJS usage Reverse sliding direction Right to left sliding transition Slides containing no images Top to bottom transition Touch swipe example Custom ease animation

children.title: API
children.description: Detailed usage of initialization options and methods to control your slider.
children.content: {$page.description} simpleslider.getSlider(options) AKA the initialization method. Creates a new simple-slider instance using the provided options, returns a Slider object. Usage example: var slider = simpleslider.getSlider({ container: document.getElementById('mysliderid') }); If options are omitted, their default value is used, here is a list with all the available options and their default values: { container: document.querySelector('*[data-simple-slider]'), children: container.children, paused: false, prop: 'left', duration: 0.5, delay: 3, init: -100, show: 0, end: 100, unit: '%', ease: defaultEase function, onChange: undefined, onChangeEnd: undefined } container The HTML element that act as a container for the slider. Defaults to document.querySelector('*[data-simple-slider]). children A list of children to be used as slides, you can use the querySelectorAll to have more flexibility on what children of the container element should be used as slides. Defaults to container.children. paused \ Controls carousel auto-transition/slideshow. If value is true no transition will happen. Defaults to false. prop \ Determines the css property to be animated. Defaults to left. duration \ Value setting the duration of animation transition. Defaults to 0.5. delay \ Value determining the wait between each animation when auto-transition is enabled. Defaults to 3 seconds. init \ Initial value of slide elements when starting a transition animation. Defaults to -100. show \ The value a slide element should have when it is displayed. Defaults to 0. end \ The value a slide will move to during a transition animation. Defaults to 100. unit \ The css unit value to be used. Defaults to %. ease \ An ease function, you can use any of these. Defaults to defaultEase internal function. onChange(prevIndex, nextIndex) \ A callback function to be defined by the user. This function will be called everytime a slide changes and will contain two arguments, the first one is the index value of the previous active slide and the second is the index value of the next slide to be inserted. onChangeEnd(prevIndex, nextIndex) \ A callback function to be defined by the user. Called everytime the animation transition is completed, it has the current displaying slide index value and the next slide index value passed as parameters. Slider The Slider object is returned when a new slider is created using simpleslider.getSlider() it exposes many methods that allow you to control it. Here you can see a list with all methods available, further bellow follows a description of each method. Slider { currentIndex() pause() resume() reverse() nextIndex() prevIndex() next() prev() change(index) dispose() } currentIndex() \ Retrieves the index of the current displaying slide. pause() Pauses the slider slideshow. resume() Resumes the slider slideshow. reverse() Swaps the values of the init property with the one from end and also reverses the order of slides. nextIndex() \ Gets the index of the next slide to be shown. prevIndex() \ Gets the index of the previous slide. next() Perform the remove animation of the actual displaying slide and insert the next one from the slide list. prev() Perform the remove animation of the actual displaying slide and insert the previous one from the slide list. change(index \) Change displaying slides, it will perform the remove animation of the actual displaying slide and insert the slide that corresponds to the provided index value. var slider = simpleslider.getSlider(); // Jumps to third slide: slider.change(2); dispose() Disposes of all internal variable references. var slider = simpleslider.getSlider(); // Free memory used by slider slider.dispose();

children.title: Search
children.description: Find what you're looking for in the documentation.
children.content: Electric Docs Start learning how to leverage the power of .

children.title: Updates
children.description: Check out what's new

features.title: New API
features.description: Amazing filesize, now under 1.2kb! API uses a factory method instead of a constructor.

features.title: Changes
features.description: The main container HTML element is now defined via container property; Default transition values now uses percentual values; Removed requestAnimationFrame polyfill.

features.title: Additions
features.description: Added children and unit as configurable properties.

features.title: New infrastructure
features.description: Uses modern js tools, such as Babel/webpack/UglifyJS for creating distribution files and running the tests.

features.title: Additions
features.description: Added methods to play()/pause() slideshow; Added support to visibilitychange API

features.title: Fixes
features.description: Fixed prevIndex() method; Fixed integration between autoPlay and change() method

features.title: Additions
features.description: Now animations supports easing function and also added prev/next functions.

features.title: Changes
features.description: Default transition is now left-to-right sliding; Some basic style is now defined on initialization; z-index position is now handled internally

features.title: First official release!
features.description: This may be considered the first official release of SimpleSlider, with consistent unit tests and use of best practices.
